census_steps.step1_des: Make sure your physical locations are correct. Also set your place of usual residence.
census_steps.step2_des: Make sure your family list is correct. Also add any other people who live with you permanently.
census_steps.step3_des: Answer the questions in each section to the best of your abilities.
census_steps.step4: Complete the census questionnaires for your household members
census_steps.step4_des: Answer the questions in each section for your households
census_steps.step5_des: Check your answers for all members and end your participation
census_steps.step1_des_Indiviual: Make sure your physical locations are correct. Also set your place of usual residence.
census_steps.step2_Indiviual: Choose your relationship to this residence
census_steps.step2_des_Indiviual: Choose your relationship to this residence
census_steps.step3_des_Indiviual: Answer the questions in each section to the best of your abilities.
census_steps.step4_des_Indiviual: Check your answers for all your census questionnaire and end your participation

rules.password: Minimum 8 characters, At least one capital letter AND one small letter AND Numbers
rules.required_Q2: You must write the name of the individual triple
rules.required_Q3: The ID or Iqama number must be written
rules.min_Q3: The ID or Iqama number is incorrect

rules.num_Q4: Incorrect kinship with the head of the family

Q6.ageRule: Age does not match the relationship with the head of the family (husband or wife).
Q6.fieldOne: You must write day of birth
Q6.fieldTwo: You must write Month of birth
Q6.fieldThree: You must write year of birth
Q6.ageParent: The age difference between the head of the family and (father / mother) must be 12 years or more
Q6.ageChildren: The age difference between the head of the family and (A son / daughter) must be 12 years or more
Q6.ageGrandsons: The age difference between the head of the family and (grandson / granddaughter) must be 24 years or more
Q6.ageGrandParent: The age difference between the head of the family and (grandfather / grandmother) must be 24 years or more

hint_10700001: when the dwelling where the household lives during the time of enumeration is considered the permanent dwelling of that household.
hint_10700002: when the dwelling where the household lives during the time of enumeration is not considered the permanent dwelling of that household but a seasonal dwelling that the household used to live in during specific seasons such as summer vacations (example: a household who lives in a village during the time of enumeration but they usually live in a permanent dwelling in a city).
hint_10700003: when the dwelling where the household lives during the time of enumeration is not considered the permanent dwelling of that household neither a seasonal dwelling, but a temporary dwelling (example: a household who lives in a temporary dwelling such as a furnished apartment during the time of enumeration because they have maintenance works in their permanent dwelling)

Q24A.rule1: The number of births in 12 months is more than 2 Are you sure?
Q24A.rule2: The number of births during the past 12 months is 1 or more and the age is 55 years and over, are you sure?

help-Center.des-01:
Sign in through Nafath or register through GASTAT website.
1. Confirm address details and select your usual place of residence
2. Confirm household members living in the same selected usual place of residence
help-Center.des-02:
It is the usual place of residence to all individuals living in the same housing unit, including head of household, household members and housekeepers.
1- Confirm addresses linked to the head of household ID number.
2- Select the usual place of residence.
help-Center.des-03:
All household members living in the selected housing unit.
• Confirm all household members living permanently in the selected housing unit and remove those living permanently in a different address
help-Center.des-04: A field enumerator will visit you in the added address for confirmation

Key-Definitions.des-01:
A household is defined as an individual or a group of individuals who are or are not related, sharing housing and food and reside in the same housing unit on Census Day including family members and housekeepers, household members include:
1- Citizens who usually live in the household and are currently outside the kingdom temporarily such as businessmen, tourists, students, and travelers to obtain medical treatment
2- Household members who usually live in the household and are not home on Census Day due to being on evening shifts such as guards, doctors, nurses, airport staff, fishmen…etc.
3- Housekeepers, drivers, and similar staff who live in the selected housing unit as a usual place of residence
Key-Definitions.des-02: Head of Household is the individual considered to be the head of the household members, usually the decision maker and the person taking care of the rest of the household members and should be 15 years of age or above.
Key-Definitions.des-03: Household member are all individuals living in the same housing unit as their usual place of residence during census period
Key-Definitions.des-04: Your current place of residance is the place where you resided for 12 month  and more, or plan to reside for the next 12 months and above, and this might be simliar or different from the address where you are on May 10th 2022. If you live at multiple locations, please select the address where you spend most of your time as your usual place of residence.
Key-Definitions.des-05: Census Sticker is a sticker that is placed at the entrance of real estate units to link the real estate unit with the head of household ID number. It is an essential step to participate through self-enumeration
Key-Definitions.des-06: The QR code has been generated to link the housing unit with the head of household ID number to enable the household to complete the census questionnaire
Key-Definitions.des-07: The unique code available on Census Sticker has been generated to link the housing unit with the head of household ID number to enable the household to complete the census questionnaire
Key-Definitions.title-08: When should I expect the visit?
Key-Definitions.des-08: Field enumerator visits start during daytime hours and last until around 9 in the evening
Key-Definitions.title-09: What if the field enumerator visited while I am not home?
Key-Definitions.des-09:
1- In the absence of the head of household, the field enumerator can speak to the individual acting on his behalf provided that he\she is over 15 years of age to complete the household Census questionnaire.
2- In case of unavailability, the visit will be rescheduled
Key-Definitions.title-10: Can I schedule the field enumerator visit?
Key-Definitions.des-10:
Scheduling the field enumerator visit option is available through Tawakkalna:
1- Ensure that the address is linked to the head of household ID number
2- Log in to the head of household Tawakkalna page
3- Select the usual place of residence for the visit
4- Choose the most suitable time from the available timeslotsScheduling the field enumerator visit option is available through Tawakkalna:
1- Ensure that the address is linked to the head of household ID number
2- Log in to the head of household Tawakkalna page
3- Select the usual place of residence for the visit
4- Choose the most suitable time from the available timeslots
